intro: Nauclea tenuiflora, commonly known as African jasmine or wild jasmine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are often hairy and arranged oppositely on the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Nauclea tenuiflora is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
